item.title: Goldeneye Source
item.dc:creator: JohnWorfin
item.description:
Maxx Skywalker:

Sorry to say this, but the N64 had far more than just a couple of good games. tbh, the only PC game that I preferred to console games at the time was Counter Strike.

Perfect Dark, Smash Bros., and Goldeneye is what filled up my time at home, and CS was played at school during home room.

I’m sorry that you are sorry and I hope you are sorry that I’m sorry that you are sorry

jambo:

What the fuck is wrong with you?

SMH

The same thing that is wrong with you, roaming around the BMS forums
but I stand by my emulator comments

Read full topic

item.title: Goldeneye Source
item.dc:creator: Maxx_Skywalker
item.description:
Very true. It was so buggy, that at times, it nigh unplayable.

JohnWorfin:

Nintendo games are for the most part shitty and are not worth the weight of the hardware they play on. . .unless you have family with disposable income to spend on crappy consoles for one or two games that are worth playing.

As a final retort, a high end PC with half way decent specs will cost anywhere near $1000, home consoles cost half that much. Now, I did spend $1000 on an excellent laptop that can handle anything I throw at it (save for Crysis – but who wants to a play a game for graphics anyways), and I purchased all my consoles with my own money (not all at once, of course), and I don’t exactly have disposable income.

The only ones I didn’t pay for was my N64 and SNES. I was gifted with a PSone, but I traded my brother for the 64 because I favored Nintendo’s system over Sony’s. And I was randomly given the SNES with twenty some odd games. I traded about 3/4 of the games to get $40 in-store credit, which was phenomenal.

I’ll give you one thing, emulation does have its advantages, however nothing outweighs the satisfaction of playing a classic game on its home console.

Read full topic

item.title: Goldeneye Source
item.dc:creator: X-tra
item.description:
LimitBreak:

I tried out this recent version of GoldenEye: Source.

Turns out that not all of the shots you fire at people actually ‘register’, which really sucks.

Explains why when I shoot someone first and they don’t die, they kill me instead.

Trust me it’s a lot better then it was since the beta 1.0.

item.title: Goldeneye Source
item.dc:creator: Maxx_Skywalker
item.description:
JohnWorfin:

Nintendo games are for the most part shitty and are not worth the weight of the hardware they play on, so emulators are really the only way to go, unless you have family with disposable income to spend on crappy consoles for one or two games that are worth playing. And in the heady days of the nes emulators and rom swapping, you could get the whole nes and super nes library in one file that fit on a cd, even if you only wanted to play 5 of them.

Sorry to say this, but the N64 had far more than just a couple of good games. tbh, the only PC game that I preferred to console games at the time was Counter Strike.

Perfect Dark, Smash Bros., and Goldeneye is what filled up my time at home, and CS was played at school during home room.

Read full topic

item.title: Goldeneye Source
item.dc:creator: coolgreek
item.description:
Kairouseki:

What do you find wrong with it?

I don’t know, it seems like it’s too easy for noobs to just spam the fire button while running around aimlessly. Perhaps I’m doing it wrong, but I try to line up my shots while aiming AND moving to avoid being hit. Although I think I’m pretty accurate with the headshots, I seem to be defeated easily by the players who do nothing more than spray fire without aiming.

Also, the spawning is pretty bad - I’ve had instances where I’ll spawn in the same area with a guy with a golden gun multiple times in a row. I know that’s a difficult thing to code, but man it sucks when you get spawn killed by a golden gun 3 times in a row!

All in all, I guess I can’t complain too much because it is a mod and they did do a decent job on emulating the original. I’m just still trying to decide if adding 16 additional players breaks the gameplay that made the original so much fun.

Read full topic

item.title: Goldeneye Source
item.dc:creator: Maxx_Skywalker
item.description:
Wasn’t aware that they were out of Beta. Nice. I shall be joining the fray sometime soon here, once the download has completed.

btw, for those who don’t know, Goldeneye 007 for the Wii isn’t exactly a remake (like what Goldeneye Source essentially is), it’s more of a remimagining of the original script with Daniel Craig instead of Pierce Brosnan. Works really well, and the online component was put together expertly. I love it, but GE: Source is the place to go for HD remade levels from the original.

And if you haven’t played the original on an actual N64, shame on you for using an emulator.

Read full topic

item.title: Goldeneye Source
item.dc:creator: X-tra
item.description:
sersoft:

Multiplayer just went out of beta, I consider that finished, and I don’t care how long I have to wait.

Well guess what it isn’t. There’s still 6-7 maps missing, 2 weapons are still being working on (the tazor boy and the lazer watch) and let’s not talk about the characters.

Trust me it’s gonna be long. :3
